Message.Title: Amazon's winding course through the patent jungle
Message.Msg: The tech IP vultures that circled around Nortel's demise reaped a hefty reward of patents, but at the cost of sharing the $4.5 billion patent windfall. Apple took the lion's share, but EMC, Ericsson, Microsoft, RIM and Sony also made out very well. Who was left out? Several likely companies, from Intel and Cisco to stalking-horse front-runner Google, and no-show Amazon. More recently, Amazon began showing more of an interest in IP, but lost an auction to Microsoft for 800-plus AOL patents worth $1 billion-plus (Google and Facebook were also counted among the losers). Undoubtedly, this stung Bezos' baby into developing a more concerted IP strategy -- and this past week, Reuters revealed that Amazon had put out a call for an "Acquisition and Investment Leader" to lead the company's push to"identify and evaluate strategic IP acquisition and licensing opportunities." One of these opportunities is undoubtedly troubled imaging-turned patent troll Eastman Kodak. which recently announced that 1,100 of its patents could go up on the auction block. http://www.patexia.com/feed/amazon-s-winding-course-through-the-patent-jungle-20120810

Message.Msg: Are you kidding? I could comfortably quadruple my position and have it increase 33% for the next year... This is a scam. It will be exposed as such in due time. The analysts will realize in retrospect that AMZN is taking on continual CapEx streams for AWS, tablets, digital content management in addition to more one time (but incredibly low ROIC) investments in local warehousing/fulfillment. Amazon had its best shot with the Fire (which is a crappy piece of hardware). Apple, Google and Samsung are gonna crush it. And, WalMart is getting more aggressive in its lowest prices anywhere (including online) campaign... AMZN is underresourced in a multifront war of its own making. The outcome is certain... You will lose.

Im short VXX until August futures expire If you look at the futures to spot, one of two things will happen: Spot will shoot up to August Futures (doubtful because that never happens), or August futures will plummet to spot dragging the septembers with it Look at VXX chart at every mothly futures expiration week. There is no technical analysis when looking at VXX since roll decay is constantly eating away at it good luck

AMZN revenues maybe up 10-20% this Q ending Sept 30, but it will probably lose money and revenue growth is clearly slowly esp for next 2 Q's over last year quaters, and yet the stock stays at over 200 p/e multiple. Current price is pricing beyond perfection--market must assume they will design and manufacture the next IPad and IPhone When this stock tanks I hope longs have a very tight stop loss on because it will be one ugly week. Message.Title: Quarterly E-Retail data due out this week
Message.Msg: For those that don't know: July retail sales are due to be released tomorrow morning at 8:30 http://www.census.gov/retail/ The quarterly E-retail sales number are scheduled to be released Thursday at 10am. http://www.census.gov/retail/mrts/www/ecreldates.pdf The last time the E-retails figures were released, May 17th, Amazon dropped $15 in 2 days. Expecting better figures to be reported this week, but I am still expecting a drop after this data comes out, especially Thursday.
